data.title: Jerry's Story
data.text:
Jerry records his only solo electric guitar performance at MGM Studios in Los Angeles, CA. for the Antonioni movie, Zabriskie Point.

Mountain Girl gives birth to Garcia's second daughter, Annabelle Walker Garcia.

Jerry and Howard Wales' first-known public performance at The Matrix in San Francisco, CA.

Jerry Garcia & Merl Saunders is formed.

Jerry's mother dies due to complications from a car accident in San Francisco.

Jerry first plays the guitar known as Alligator onstage.

Jerry, John Kahn, David Grisman, Peter Rowan, and Richard Greene perform for the first time as Old & in the Way at the Record Plant in Sausalito, CA. Vassar Clements would later replace Greene on fiddle.

Jerry first plays Wolf onstage with Merl Saunders at a private party for the Hell's Angels.

The Great American String Band featuring Jerry, Richard Green, David Grisman, Taj Mahal, and David Nichtern make their debut performance at the Pilgrimage Theater in Hollywood, CA. Buell Neidlinger would replace Taj Mahal on bass for the band’s next six and final gigs.

Mountain Girl gives birth to Garcia's third daughter, Theresa Adams "Trixie" Garcia.

Legion of Mary, consisting of Jerry, Merl Saunders, John Kahn, Martin Fierro, and Ron Tutt, hold their first public performance at Sophie’s in Palo Alto, CA.

Jerry performs under the name Jerry Garcia Band for the first time, alongside John Kahn, Nicky Hopkins, and Ron Tutt at Keystone in Berkeley, CA.

Jerry appears in the movie Close Encounters of the Third Kind as an extra during the crowd scenes in India. During the following year, the Grateful Dead would occasionally improvise the theme from Close Encounters in concert.

Reconstruction, featuring Jerry, John Kahn, Merl Saunders, Ed Neumeister, Ron Stallings, and Gaylord Birch, make their first public appearance at The Keystone in Berkeley, CA.

Jerry first plays Tiger onstage at the Oakland Auditorium.

Jerry's decade-long heroin addiction culminates in the rest of the Grateful Dead holding an intervention. Given the choice between the band or the drugs, Jerry agrees to check into a rehabilitation center in Oakland, CA.

Before the start of his program in Oakland, Jerry is arrested for drug possession in Golden Gate Park; he subsequently attends a drug diversion program.

Jerry lapses into a near-fatal diabetic coma for five days, after which he has to relearn the guitar.

The Grateful Dead return to performing five months after Jerry emerges from his coma.

Jerry begins using Rosebud as his main guitar.

Jerry and David Grisman perform together for the first time publicly at Sweetwater in Mill Valley, CA.

Jerry falls ill, and the Grateful Dead cancels their upcoming Fall Tour.

Jerry first plays Lightning Bolt onstage at the Shoreline Amphitheatre.

The Grateful Dead is inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

Jerry and Deborah Koons marry on Valentine's Day in Sausalito, CA.

Jerry receives Top Hat from luthier Stephen Cripe, but never plays it live.

Jerry passes away at Serenity Knolls Treatment Center in Forest Knolls, CA, at age fifty-three.

Jerry is celebrated by twenty-five thousand family and friends at a public memorial in Golden Gate Park. Memorials span the nation as people all over mourn his passing.
